stories.title: Record heat can bake your Steam Deck and Switch, devicemakers warn

stories.text:
Hi, happy friend's day to everyone.

I'm from Argentina and we celebrate friend's day today, July 20. And it is because the moon landing.

We are very proud to celebrate that day, because we are very, very friendly. Friends to us is everything, we can be noisy, we have the motto to be "too full of himself" and we keep doing the same mistakes. But we are really friendly.

And today and thanks to Enrique Fabbraro that was the guy that started today this celebration, it is a day to be with friends. And we need to thanks science too and a lot of people that worked for the Apollo program, because that inspired this celebration. In his own words: “I experienced the moon landing as a gesture of friendship towards the universe and at the same time I told myself that a town of friends would be an unbeatable nation. Then it was decided: 20th of July is the chosen day”

So, happy friend's day! Happy science and keep the memory of those that inspired other people to be better ones.
stories.title: Apollo Xi and Friend's Day
Show HN: Computer algebra in 99 lines of Python

stories.text:
Sorry, the usual question... :P

This morning I read the post "The Rust Performance Book (2020)" and when I wanted to upvote it 10 hours later I had to go to page #4 (ranked currently #108 with 184 votes "20 hours ago") => finding it on page #4 was weird for me (I would have never found that precious post if I would have checked HN only this evening).

The usual reply to my kind of question is "click on 'past' to see a kind-of-better ranking" but after having done that exactly >now< I see for example:

- at position #41 "Logo and Learning (2015)" (63 points, 3 days ago, 26 comments) and...

- at position #42 "America’s favorite family outings are increasingly out of reach" ( 270 points, 1 day ago, 569 comments) - btw. I read this and for me it wasn't great but still interesting, so in the end I liked it, at least 10000 times more than "logo and learning" (which I glanced over).

I don't like the current ranking :(
stories.title: Ask HN: Did HN's page rankings become more extreme?

stories.text:
After being frustrated with the budget and learning curve requirements of the big names in the Virtual Production field, I decided to create my own all-in-one platform designed with beginners and less-technical folk in mind. It takes complicated tasks in other engines (tracking, compositing, floor plans, etc.) and makes them two-click solutions. And, with the free companion mobile app, you can track cameras, scan your sets, and (coming soon) do full body motion capture!

There's a ton more features that I'm super proud of, and I'm open to any and all feedback! Thanks!
stories.title: Show HN: I built an all-in-one virtual production platform for indies
